newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Mondragon to spin off consumer division.
newsitem.headline: Mondragon to spin off consumer division.

text.p: Mondragon International Phils Inc said on Thursday it planned to spin off its consumer products division and concentrate on gaming and leisure development as its core business.
The firm said in a statement the major shareholder of Mondragon, Jose Antonio Gonzalez, has agreed to buy the firm's consumer products division.

"This action will free Mondragon of a business that is performing below expectations, and enable the company to concentrate its efforts in its more lucrative lines, namely gaming and leisure," the statement said.
Mondragon operates a hotel and casino at the Clark economic zone in northern Luzon island.

The firm said it posted a 92.2 percent rise in net income in the first nine months of the year to 323 million pesos from the year-ago 168 million pesos despite a 54-million peso loss from its consumer products division.

"Increasing competition in the apparel and cosmetics markets, particularly due to the stepped up efforts of multinational direct-selling companies, point to a less rosy picture for this portion of Mondragon's business."
Mondragon said the Gonzalez family agreed to buy the firm's consumer products division to improve the profitability of the company.
"A fair valuation of the business will be conducted by highly reputable and independent appraisers to determine the selling price (of the division to be spun off)," Mondragon said.
